I seem to have gotten all the dependencies sorted out, all that remains
is =
what seems to be language syntax differences between compilers (or
versions=
). Which compiler and version was it originally written for?
I've tried com=
piling with GCC (G++) versions 3.3, 3.4, 4.1 and 4.2, for
versions >=3D 3.4=
 I get errors like:

HCUBE_EvaluationPanel.h:9: error: expected class-name =
before `{'
token

HCUBE_EvaluationPanel.h:48: error: `wxPaintEvent' has not=
 been
declared

(These seems to be a problem with the wxwidgets library, wh=
ich seems odd
given that I installed it from the Ubuntu repositories):

/us=
r/include/wx-2.8/wx/cursor.h:65: error: `wxIsBusy' was not
declared in this=
 scope

/usr/include/wx-2.8/wx/gtk1/region.h:47: error: no matching functio=
n for
call to `wxRegion::Union(const wxBitmap&, const wxColour&,
int&)'

/u=
sr/include/wx-2.8/wx/region.h:127: note: candidates are: bool
wxRegionBase:=
:Union(wxCoord, wxCoord, wxCoord, wxCoord)

Any ideas anyone? I'm thinking =
I should modify the code (not sure what
do about wxwidgets though) to compi=
le under G++ 4.2 and post it back to
this group, but would like as much inf=
o as I can get before proceeding
with this.
